definitions.definition: to make or become full; to use empty space:
examples: I filled the bucket with water.

definitions.definition: to put a substance into an empty space:
examples: Before painting, fill (in) all the cracks in the plaster.

definitions.definition: to make someone have a partricular feeling:
examples: figurative The thought of it fills me with (= makes me feel) dread.

definitions.definition: to put a substance into a hole in a tooth to repair it:
examples: You should get that cavity filled.

definitions.definition: someone's fill is as much as they want or can deal with:
examples: He took only a few minutes to eat/drink his fill.
